website_summaries.verdict: This high-end roof hook is designed for use with a variety of ladders.
pros: Works great with single or extension ladders
Easy to fit between ladder's top rungs
Expertly crafted from powder-coated steel for durability
Equipped with wing nuts for fast, effective tightening
cons: Not ideal for roof with ridge vent or cedar shakes

customer_reviews.title: SAVE $50 ON PAIR! Works as described! Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, be sure to buy a pair as you need TWO PER LADDER. Works with a shingle over style ridge vent with no problem. I used them with a werner 24 foot ladder broken down into two sections. I highly recommend... PRO TIP: change the quantity in your cart to 2 and you will save about 50 bucks for whatever reason. If you choose the pair option in the box the cost is around $90 bucks. Choose the one only option for $22 bucks, then change quantity in cart to 2 and get a pair for around $45 bucks instead of $90. Not really sure why they have it setup that way....
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you have expensive shingles!
customer_reviews.text: My 12/12 pitch roof is covered with Certainteed Grand Manor Shingles and topped with a large 12 inch wide vented ridge cap. This ladder hook is way too small to extend over the ridge cap. The ladder hook actually dug deep into the middle of the ridge cap damaging it which will cost me hundreds of dollars to repair. This hook needs to be 12 inches longer and the hook end needs to extend about 6 inches further to reach past the ridge cap. If you have inexpensive shingles and a small 6 inch ridge cap, then this hook may work for you.
customer_reviews.author: William B. Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: These are very well made, but the design is lacking. On my steep pitch roof (and perhaps any roof), they only engage an inch or two over the ridge. With a metal ridge cap they can be disengaged with minimal force. If the legs were made just a couple inches longer, and bent to a better angle (rather than a radius), they would be SO much better! They were inexpensive, but I will not use them again. They will spend the rest of their lives in the pile of junk in the barn. Not worth the trouble to return. Please, improve this product! It would be so easy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed to save money
customer_reviews.text: I had to have some siding replaced and trim work on the house however the company installing would not paint. Unfortunately for me my roof where the trim/siding is located is rather steep. I Purchased two of these ladder hooks they worked perfectly and save me a substantial amount of money. They are very well-made and heavy duty I am approximately 6ft tall, 300 pounds and they didn’t flinch with my fat ass.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: great product !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These ladder hooks are awesome they work great for putting up metal roofing on my cabin I am building . I would not be able to get on the steel roof without these . I would highly recommend purchasing these.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Buckley

customer_reviews.title: Worked well to repair shingles on my dormer.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these to use on my roof. I took the top fly off my 32' extension ladder and put the 2 hooks on it. Being fiberglass, the ladder was still a bit challenging to move around on the roof. The wheels on the hooks helped. My roof is 12/12 pitch and it fit right over the top. I did also tie the ladder for double-security so it wouldn't fall. I able to climb down the ladder from my dormer roof and repair the shingles. Much better way than any other I could think of to reach the shingles. That being said, hopefully won't have to use them again!
customer_reviews.author: cmp1313

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly & saved me a ton of money!
customer_reviews.text: Okay so I had to replace a small bit of chimney liner, along with a few blocks & a chimney cap, well I have a strongly pitched metal roof that sits about 32 feet off the ground at the highest point so needless to say it is a bit intimidating. Using these, and a 24' extension ladder I was able to securely and safely place this on my roof and it held beautifully. In addition to using my fall protection harness and rigging I felt as safe as if I were standing on flat ground. Highly recommended as they're easy to install, and incredibly well built, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: E.S.J.B

customer_reviews.title: Best added security on a roof for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I used these to repair siding on a 12/12 pitch and felt secure the entire time I was in the roof. I used two hooks for my ladder and it never once budged. I test bounced and leaned somewhat just to get my bearings and it was solid. I was highly impressed and these are worth every penny! They are heavy once they are attached to the end of your ladder however, so pushing them and controlling them up the roof takes some strength and finesse due to the independent roller on the bottom. I trust these paired with a properly secured harness on high, steep pitches.
customer_reviews.author: Gymtwitch89

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: It is too small to hold to the top of my roof. Otherwise seems to be solid and heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Ruslan Sudentas

customer_reviews.title: Not safe with roof vent caps
customer_reviews.text: We work on the roof daily and usually just utilize rope and harness, we bought this for steep roofs, it just doesn’t fit far enough over vent caps, it ended up sliding off the roof today luckly no one was hurt as we didn’t trust this and kept our guys roped up. Not to be used with any roof with a vent cap (which is most roofs)....
customer_reviews.author: justin bitner

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended if you do roof work
customer_reviews.text: We had to do some work on a steep metal roof and these worked perfectly. I ordered two of these due to the suggestion but I think one would work if need be and had to have two ladders on the roof. They are easy to use and rolled up the metal roof with ease but haven't tried them on shingles yet. There are others out there with padding on the part that contacts the roof which I'm sure will wear off and also cost more but for the cost of these I can add my own padding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very strong and does not fail!!!
customer_reviews.text: I would buy more if I could use them!!!! Saved my fat ass from falling off my new roof and couldn’t be happier. Buying this helped me avoid a very expensive harness and damaging my new structure by installing the harness anchor. Now all my neighbors want to borrow them lol.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great once you replace the bolt with a longer one.
customer_reviews.text: This product is great once it's set up correctly. The bolts that came with it were very short for the application (I couldn't even get the nut on with one of my ladders). Once I put a bolt on that was 1/2" longer, it worked great. I even was able to put it a couple rungs from the end on a shorter roof (though this made the wheels almost unusable). Much better than the old bolt on ladder hooks.
customer_reviews.author: Jason P.

customer_reviews.title: Quick, sturdy, can be trusted
customer_reviews.text: Solid tool! Had roof work to do and didn't want to die, so started looking at easy solutions. This is it. Strong, secure, I trust it. Just be careful sliding it up the roof...the swiveling castor allows it to drift left & right and it's easy to let it get away from you if not alert and aware. I may remove the swivel, we'll see. But once secured, very stable.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas R Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Ladder hooks make roof work much safer!
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I needed. I have been postponing the installation of a cell phone booster antenna because i needed to string coax from the antenna, across the top of of the roof. With these I did the job in about an hour and always felt safe. I did duct tape some padding on the cleats to protect the finish on my metal roof.
customer_reviews.author: Circle C

customer_reviews.title: The Swivel Wheel is a Safety Hazard!!
customer_reviews.text: Like another reviewer pointed out, the Swivel Wheel is a Safety Hazard!! I hooked up a simple werner ladder and the whole thing slid sideways and down the other side of the roof ( lucky for me ) taking the gutter down with it. AVOID!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great but a little short to fit properly on the ladder
customer_reviews.text: I used this to refurb some wood / stucco siding on my house on a very steep roof and it did the job but the manufacturer needs to extend the hooks and the clamps that attach it to the ladder just an inch or two. Otherwise it held up find after repeated uses.
customer_reviews.author: Canuuk

customer_reviews.title: It worked basically fine; however
customer_reviews.text: I used two of these hooks to scale the roof of my garage. The ladder segment was about 12' long, and I was placing the segment on the roof from the top of another ladder. It worked basically fine; however, I had trouble flipping the ladder over because of the swiveling wheels - the ladder wanted to slide sideways on the wheel. I'd suggest buying ladder hooks with fixed wheels rather than swivel wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Carla S.

customer_reviews.title: works, but is definitely limited and requires rigging some padding...
customer_reviews.text: Its steel. Seems pretty strong. Limitations that you should be aware of: 1) Heavy (x 2). 2) you can't use this on a part of a roof with a ridge vent - it follows the contour of the roof - there is not space underneath to clear a ridge vent. 3) The edges are very sharp and it will dig into whatever roof material you have when you try to flip the ladder over after rolling it up the roof - you MUST rig up some padding. I duct-taped on some left over pipe insulation.
customer_reviews.author: Kanga

customer_reviews.title: Nice heavy duty quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy duty quality. Made being on a steep roof a lot more comfortable. My only advice is to be careful when lowering the ladder...the caster wheel will spin to left or right and cause the ladder to roll down the roof. If using with a large heavy ladder, I would advise to have a rope tied to the top rung of the ladder and have someone on the ground opposite of your position to assist in lowering the ladder down the roof.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality!  Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: Certainly a very heavy duty ladder hook, but with that comes some pretty substantial weight, especially when using two (even though they are sold individually), which is highly recommended for added safety. Another possible downside is that, unlike most other brands of ladder hook, the wheel swivels, which can sometimes cause the ladder to travel partially sideways when pushing it toward the roof peak. But, unless someone is using these hooks literally everyday, the lower price of the hook (especially in comparison with other brands) certainly does offset the issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: D. H. Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Used this ladder hook to place ladder on roof so I could paint overhanging eves. Worked great with standard aluminum ladder. As some people have mentioned, the included bolts are barely long enough for a standard ladder so if you have a heavy-duty ladder, you’ll need to grab some longer bolts. Hooks worked as described and felt secure in my metal roof. I used 2 as recommended and though some have said that they only used one, I wouldn’t want to gamble a 25 foot fall on just one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Poore

customer_reviews.title: If your working on a steep roof you need the proper safety equipment in my opinion.
customer_reviews.text: It worked OK with one but it was kind of hard to maneuver when I added a second one to the ladder it became very hard to maneuver and rolled around that is my experience. It is handy to get to a spot on the roof but I found it too difficult to move to do a lot of work on a steep roof just using this.
customer_reviews.author: C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great accessory.
customer_reviews.text: Work great. Helped me fix the siding on my house where a raccoon chewed into the addic. Caught him in a trap, but other critters liked the hole he made. Felt safe and secure while on the ladder. Make sure you have a long enough ladder. I was a little short and had to use my arm strength to get up onto the ladder. Was a workout. Felt safe and secure the whole time.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Fits best if the ladder is fully extended as opposed to ...
customer_reviews.text: I used it on a 8/12 pitch roof. Fits best if the ladder is fully extended as opposed to "doubled up". Instructions say not recommended for roofs with roof ridge vents but worked fine on mine and did not damage my roof vent.
customer_reviews.author: EM

customer_reviews.title: Work well on steep pitched roof
customer_reviews.text: I have a steep pitched roof and built a home made wooden ladder and attached the hooks to it. The hooks work really well. The only complaint I have is that the metal will scratch the metal roof, so I tied bicycle tubes to the underside of the hooks.
customer_reviews.author: SRT

customer_reviews.title: Did the job
customer_reviews.text: It was a little hard on the roofing that was already in place the angle iron needed to be more rounder and a plastic or rubber cushion boot would have been nice.
customer_reviews.author: K. McCune

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and secure
customer_reviews.text: These secure a ladder to the roof quite nicely. they are easy to attach. The wheels make it easy to roll the ladder up the roof without marring the shingles.
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: There were 2 peaks on my house I couldn't reach, even with a long ladder. With these hooks, I was able to create a very stable base on my 12/12 pitch roof, using a long extension ladder. Then I built a small wooden platform that hooked over the rungs of the extension ladder which gave me a level place to stand. I was also able to place another ladder on this platform to reach the high peaks. It sounds dangerous, but it was very stable (I recommend using a safety harness ). It saved me hundreds of dollars since I didn't have to hire a professional painter.
customer_reviews.author: UT customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for getting on the roof safely.
customer_reviews.text: Works great very sturdy and strong. The only con I have is the wheel should be stationary because when you roll the latter up the roof you are just pushing it straight up on the roof to the peak, with the wheels being able to rotate the latter could roll to the side on you. Which almost happened to me.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Himmerich

customer_reviews.title: Swivel wheel is dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Save your life or avoid serious injury! Change the swivel wheel to a NON-swivel before using!!! this way the ladder won't roll sideways on accident and will only roll up and down as it should.
customer_reviews.author: 2FOR5_Carolinas

customer_reviews.title: HEAVY!
customer_reviews.text: Oh it's STURDY alright. And it DOES work as it should. However, these things are WAY to heavy. No need for weight like that. Makes flipping it over WAY too hard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband at his request and he says it works great and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer S.

customer_reviews.title: Not Very Uniform
customer_reviews.text: As per the description, two of these are required per ladder. However, after unpacking and setting them up next to each other on a flat workbench, the large bends near the wheel end are not consistent with each other. There is about a half inch difference. I have yet to actually use these on a roof, so I am not sure if this will impact the way the ladder sits. It may be that when weight is applied they will seek a balance, but only time will tell. The free shipping was great and they arrived as promised.
customer_reviews.author: jjflash52

customer_reviews.title: Good Item
customer_reviews.text: Works great on D ring ladders. You have to be a little smarter than the ladder. It only goes on one way to fit right. all the other reviews were putting it on wrong. The bolts are long enough and it fits tight if you put it on right.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Chesla

customer_reviews.title: I have to thank other Amazon reviewers for guiding my decision
customer_reviews.text: Read earlier reviews, that's what I did before I decided upon these ladder hooks. (Ordered 2) My husbands old roofing ladder was in great shape but for the hooks. I read the reviews here and decided upon this hook because of the wheel. Once they were installed on the ladder, I taped the hook end with (red) duct tape because I was leery of the damage they might do to the roof shingles. These hooks made a great save for an otherwise good ladder gone bad.
customer_reviews.author: Marge M

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Works well. A little hard to steer I only got one two might be better
customer_reviews.author: Robert Turlip

customer_reviews.title: ease of use
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Able to pain second story of home with out any problems
customer_reviews.author: paul h velazquez

customer_reviews.title: Great Invention
customer_reviews.text: For safety, you should really use two of these per ladder. But I had a small job to do, and wondered when I'd ever need a pair of these again. Now I'm not telling you to do what I did, but I mounted on;y one to my ladder, and it worked great for my purposes. The slope I needed to walk/sit on would've been far too steep without this handy little tool. It made the seemingly impossible a piece of cake.
customer_reviews.author: Bill A

customer_reviews.title: Nice Heavy Duty Product
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality. Made of heavy gauge steel. I used two of these on a 24 extension ladder to fix a roof problem on a very steep roof. I used a piece of waterline pipe insulation tapped to the hook end to keep from damaging the roof at the peak when flipping the ladder over. It does make the end of the ladder relatively heavy so when moving the ladder you will need to adjust for that. I felt very safe on the ladder but you should also use other safety restraints.
customer_reviews.author: billyflynn

customer_reviews.title: Not for use with ridge vents
customer_reviews.text: Once it arrived, I read the instructions which stated "Not for use on a roof with a ridge vent". I sent them back. Its unfortunate that wasn't clear in the spec sheet. Before purchasing, I learned from the reviews that you need to buy a pair of the hooks, even though they are sold as single units. They are a clever design and would probably work fine in the right circumstance.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Myers

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, needs longer bolts.
customer_reviews.text: I attached a pair of these to my 36 foot Werner ladder to accomplish some roof repairs. Solidly built, made moving the ladder up the roof much easer, but as somebody else mentioned, the included bolts are too short. Seems like an easy fix, the extra trip to the hardware store cost them a star.
customer_reviews.author: nam11b

customer_reviews.title: Must have for all professional house painters!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional residential and commercial painter, I had a very steep pitched roof I need to to work on in order to spray the top portions of the house and these hooks really helped get the job done. I bought two hooks and used them on my extension ladder and my adjustable Wagner A frame ladder. I felt safe using these hooks and I am 215 pounds!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Fago

customer_reviews.title: Worked well with some added support
customer_reviews.text: I was able to set up a chicken ladder to get on my metal barn roof using these and a heavy-duty extension ladder (the roof is about 22 feet from eave to ridge). I clamped a 2x6 to the bottom of the ladder for extra support--I don't think I would have felt comfortable using only the ladder hooks. The wheels enabled me to position the ladder on the roof by myself.
customer_reviews.author: David A Smith

customer_reviews.title: Should be sold in pairs
customer_reviews.text: Concept is great but you need two in order for one person to set your ladder where you want it. Worked well on very steep pitched roof.
customer_reviews.author: leecrowell

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR USE ON ROOF W/RIDGE VENT
customer_reviews.text: My rating is not based on the product. My rating is due to poor product specifications listed on Amazon's site; nowhere does it say that these hooks cannot be used on a home with a vented ridge. The product came with no directions except for a small label on each hook indicating how to install with a tiny, hard-to-see picture. The last line on the label says the product is not recommended for use on a vented ridge. Now that I've opened (and tossed) the box, Amazon won't take them back. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Boehm

customer_reviews.title: Requires retrofit for larger ladders
customer_reviews.text: Works very well on ladders with 1.5” rungs, but installation bolt isn’t long enough for 1.75” rungs. A trip to the hardware store might yield bolts long enough to fit.
customer_reviews.author: AWds

customer_reviews.title: This was a great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This item worked very well for the steep roof that we need to work on. It is sturdy, simple and a great value!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: These attached very easily and securely to half of my extension ladder
customer_reviews.text: These attached very easily and securely to half of my extension ladder, which then rolled nicely up the roof. The hook was long enough to go past the ridge vent.The angle iron on the hook evened out the load so no damage was done to the roof. I am not particularly fond of going on my roof as it is a 12/12 pitch, (a 45 degree angle), but I felt comfortable knowing that my feet would not slide down the roof. I may not need them again, but for what I needed they were great.
customer_reviews.author: Brutus

customer_reviews.title: LADDER HOOKS WORKED GREAT
customer_reviews.text: its best to purchase 2 ladder hooks for steeper roofs. was able to apply metal roof to my a-frame cabin with out any problems. these hooks were a time saver and worked great
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo 114

customer_reviews.title: Resellers are jerks.
customer_reviews.text: You need 2, returned mine went and bought the set for a few more dollars at the store.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Murphree

customer_reviews.title: The swivel wheel could be a problem.
customer_reviews.text: The swivel allow the ladder to go sideways instead of up the roof. I had to lock the swivel so it would go up the roof correctly. The steeper the roof the bigger the problem.
customer_reviews.author: JSSussex

customer_reviews.title: Ladder hook
customer_reviews.text: The product overall worked well however the swivel caster wheel made it difficult to control the ladder when pushing up the roof and into the desired position.
customer_reviews.author: KHH

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 hooks so I could access my very steep roof. The products seems very well made and very heavy and durable. Unfortunately, these hooks don't fit on a 28' or 24' Werner ladder! So, I have a useless product that doesn't fit on the most widely used ladder available on the market.
customer_reviews.author: FootyPhotog

customer_reviews.title: Does what's needed
customer_reviews.text: Well, I've never used these before. They weren't hard to attach, and I rolled the ladder right up the roof and flipped it over. I didn't feel uneasy climbing up on the roof with the ladder hook over the ridge of the roof. I patched my roof, flipped the ladder over and rolled it down. So, I figure I got my money's worth during that use, and I have them for next time, also. Maybe you'd want to spend more if you did roofing for a living, but for a homeowner who doesn't want to fall off the roof, it's just the ticket.
customer_reviews.author: Diamondplate Dave

customer_reviews.title: Helps me feel safer
customer_reviews.text: I've used this several times while painting. It helps me feel safer on some of these tall houses. Takes a minute to learn how to attatch it and how to move about on the roof tho.
customer_reviews.author: IamUprise

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This was used to climb on our roof.The roof is a 5/12 pitch and it worked as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Cieklinski

customer_reviews.title: Ok but it’s worth it to spend extra and get a better one
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok. It didn’t fit my ladder I had to buy a bigger bolt
customer_reviews.author: kramer

customer_reviews.title: Felt safe and secure
customer_reviews.text: Increased top weight of the ladder quite a bit. Be careful not to lose control when pushing it up your roof. Worked great and I felt very secure on our steep roof.
customer_reviews.author: Alphazu

customer_reviews.title: Works Great & Secure
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and remove- works great and very stable. Safest way to climb a roof to paint an otherwise inaccessible peak. Great solution!
customer_reviews.author: Hank Reardon

customer_reviews.title: Comes with Two in the Package unlike the description says!
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is I wanted two on my ladder for added security and the description clearly says "One Hook" so I interpreted that as meaning the package came with one, wrong, I opened the first package and was surprised to see two in the box so now I have 4? Price is reasonable, guess I'll sell one on a local Craigs or something as I only need the two.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Goulding

customer_reviews.title: workes as expected
customer_reviews.text: Used only one of these hooks on my ladder and a wore a harness to repair shingles
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did the trick on a roof job to help with ladder safety
customer_reviews.text: Bought for roof job for my dad - he said they did the trick - decent value for the money - remember you will probably need 2 !! Kind of odd they don't sell in pairs.... or at least when I purchased them...
customer_reviews.author: Dale McCord

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but is cumbersome due to the recommended use of two units and their weight.
customer_reviews.text: Serves it purpose. Dealing with it on the end of an extension ladder section up on the roof is problematic due to the additional weight that the unit presents. Instructions are to use two hooks for safety and that adds a further burden due to the weight. The wheel does assist in sliding the ladder and hook up the roof. Lighter weight construction of the hook and use on one unit would result in higher rating of this item.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Consuegra

customer_reviews.title: Good unit, but ...
customer_reviews.text: you will have to put a screw in the swiveling wheel to keep the ladder from rolling off the roof as you slide it up.
customer_reviews.author: Bhaktan

customer_reviews.title: Roof hooks worked well
customer_reviews.text: These roof hooks worked fine. They are very sturdy. The only thing I would change is to get rid of the castor wheels and replace them with wheels that don’t swivel. Swiveling lets the ladder go where it wants instead of where you want.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Great product made my work a lot safer
customer_reviews.text: This ladder hook worked just as expected, I would definitely buy it again. The only suggestion I have is that it should come with 2 1/2” bolts as that is what is needed to work on heavy duty ladders. It was easy to purchase them but I had to leave the job.
customer_reviews.author: larry

customer_reviews.title: Bolt Not Long Enough
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't fit on my 24' Louisville ladder. You need to buy a longer bolt for the wing nut.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: easily remedied. For your safety
customer_reviews.text: Roof hook works as advertised. You may have a problem with"d" shaped steps on your ladder, easily remedied. For your safety, two hooks per ladder is best.
customer_reviews.author: Incana

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: That is what I was looking for. They are very helpful. Easy to install and very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: juan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for slate and other things!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this months and months ago for doing slate repairs which it helped quite a bit. But today we used it to keep the ladder off the gutters so we could replace the gutters... while I don't believe that it was designed to do that, it did us really well and saved a lot of time by letting us work from the ladder versus attempting to attach a gutter while on the roof. I bought 2. You really need 2 to be stable.
customer_reviews.author: Munchies Organic

customer_reviews.title: Should have gotten them years ago.
customer_reviews.text: I've been a do it diy-er for years. This is the latest addition to my collection and I wish I'd have gotten these years ago. It was very handy to use a ladder as the support on steep roofs and the wheels make it easy.to "flip-move-flip" from the bottom of the ladder (still on roof).
customer_reviews.author: GJJB

customer_reviews.title: Works.  Required fiddling
customer_reviews.text: These hooks secured the ladder to the roof well. I think you need two to safely secure the ladder. I found it was not possible to keep the hooks from sliding laterally even if I cranked down on the wingnut -- they would not stay up against the sides of the ladder, so I had to tie them to the ladder sides to keep them in place. Not a huge problem.
customer_reviews.author: penorman

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I have an A-framed house with a cedar roof that needs annual maintenance to stay in shape. Most ladders aren't tall enough to get me to the top. This hook lets me hang a ladder from the peak and work safely without harming my cedar shakes. I trust this thing with my life.
customer_reviews.author: KT and the Squid

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: My only suggestion would be making the wheel a little wider so it is easier to balance when using one of these on a ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P.

customer_reviews.title: I bought two of these for my ladder for use ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my ladder for use on a metal roof to access the chimney. I had read reviews where this was not meant for use on metal roofs, but I was unable to find what I needed, so I decided to try this product. Qualcraft 2481 Ladder Hook with Wheel

AMAZON.COM
The Qual-Craft ladder hook comes complete with a convenient wheel to roll the ladder along the roof without damaging shingles. Sporting a tough, steel construction for added durability, the ladder hook adjusts to fit between the top two ladder rungs. The ladder hook fits single or extension ladders in wood, fiberglass, or aluminum in both round and D rung styles. Two hooks must be used per ladder.
